theorem Topology.interior_closure_eq_self_of_isOpen {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]
    {A : Set X} (hA_open : IsOpen (A : Set X)) :
    interior (closure (A : Set X)) = A := by
  -- Prove the two inclusions separately.
  apply Set.Subset.antisymm
  · -- `interior (closure A) ⊆ A`
    intro x hx_int
    -- `x` is also in `closure A`.
    have hx_cl : x ∈ closure (A : Set X) := interior_subset hx_int
    -- Assume, for contradiction, that `x ∉ A`.
    by_contra h_notA
    -- Unpack the neighbourhood witnessing `x ∈ interior (closure A)`.
    rcases hx_int with ⟨U, hU_open, hxU, hU_sub⟩
    -- The set `U \ A` is an open neighbourhood of `x`, disjoint from `A`.
    have hW_open : IsOpen (U \ A) := hU_open.diff hA_open
    have hxW : (x : X) ∈ U \ A := by
      exact ⟨hxU, h_notA⟩
    -- Since `x ∈ closure A`, this neighbourhood must intersect `A`.
    have h_nonempty :=
      (mem_closure_iff).1 hx_cl (U \ A) hW_open hxW
    -- Extract a witness leading to a contradiction.
    rcases h_nonempty with ⟨y, ⟨hyW, hyA⟩⟩
    exact (hyW.2 hyA).elim
  · -- `A ⊆ interior (closure A)`
    have h_subset : (A : Set X) ⊆ closure (A : Set X) := subset_closure
    exact interior_maximal h_subset hA_open

import Mathlib
import Aesop

open Set

namespace Topology

variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]

/--  
If `A` satisfies `P1` and `B` is open, then the intersection `A ∩ B`
also satisfies `P1`. -/
theorem P1_inter_left_of_open {A B : Set X}
    (hPA : P1 (X := X) A) (hB_open : IsOpen (B : Set X)) :
    P1 (X := X) (A ∩ B) := by
  -- Unfold the definition of `P1`.
  dsimp [P1] at hPA ⊢
  intro x hxAB
  -- Split the membership in the intersection.
  rcases hxAB with ⟨hxA, hxB⟩
  -- First put `x` in `closure (interior A)` using `P1` for `A`.
  have hx_clA : (x : X) ∈ closure (interior A) := hPA hxA
  -- Show that `x` also lies in `closure (interior A ∩ B)`.
  have hx_cl_inter : (x : X) ∈ closure (interior A ∩ B) := by
    -- Use the neighbourhood characterisation of closure.
    apply (mem_closure_iff).2
    intro U hU_open hxU
    -- Intersect the neighbourhood with the open set `B`.
    have hUB_open : IsOpen (U ∩ B) := hU_open.inter hB_open
    have hxUB : (x : X) ∈ U ∩ B := ⟨hxU, hxB⟩
    -- Since `x ∈ closure (interior A)`, the set `U ∩ B` meets `interior A`.
    have h_nonempty : ((U ∩ B) ∩ interior A).Nonempty := by
      have h_cl := (mem_closure_iff).1 hx_clA
      simpa [inter_assoc, inter_left_comm, inter_comm] using h_cl (U ∩ B) hUB_open hxUB
    -- Extract a witness in `U ∩ (interior A ∩ B)`.
    rcases h_nonempty with ⟨y, ⟨⟨hyU, hyB⟩, hy_intA⟩⟩
    refine ⟨y, ?_⟩
    refine ⟨hyU, ?_⟩
    -- `B` is open, so `interior B = B`.
    have hy_intB : (y : X) ∈ interior B := by
      simpa [hB_open.interior_eq] using hyB
    -- Hence `y ∈ interior A ∩ B`.
    exact ⟨hy_intA, by
      -- Rewrite `hy_intB` to a membership in `B`.
      simpa [hB_open.interior_eq] using hy_intB⟩
  -- Rewrite `interior (A ∩ B)` using openness of `B`.
  have h_int_eq : interior ((A ∩ B) : Set X) = interior A ∩ B := by
    simpa [hB_open.interior_eq] using interior_inter (A := A) (B := B)
  -- Convert the membership obtained above.
  simpa [h_int_eq] using hx_cl_inter

end Topology

theorem Topology.P2_union_right_of_open {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hPA : Topology.P2 (X := X) A) (hB_open : IsOpen (B : Set X)) :
    Topology.P2 (X := X) (A ∪ B) := by
  -- `B` is open, hence it satisfies `P2`.
  have hPB : Topology.P2 (X := X) B :=
    (isOpen_implies_P2 (X := X) (A := B) hB_open)
  -- Combine the two `P2` hypotheses using the existing union lemma.
  exact Topology.P2_union (X := X) (A := A) (B := B) hPA hPB
